intro: Morina chlorantha, commonly known as the yellow moringa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and Africa. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and oval-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks. Despite its ornamental value, it is not widely cultivated for commercial purposes.
